problem.prob_desc: 29. 첫째항과 공비가 각각 0이 아닌 두 등비수열 $\{a_n\},\ \{b_n\}$에 대하여 두 급수 $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n,\ \sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} b_n$이 각각 수렴하고 $$\begin{align} \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n b_n = \left( \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n \right) \times \left( \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_n \right), \\ 3 \times \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} |a_{2n}| = 7 \times \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} |a_{3n}| \end{align}$$이 성립한다. $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} \dfrac{b_{2n-1} + b_{3n+1}}{b_n} = S$일 때, $120S$의 값을 구하시오. [4점]

gpt-5-codex.title: Represent sequences algebraically
gpt-5-codex.body: Let the geometric sequences be a_n = A r^{n-1} and b_n = B s^{n-1} with nonzero A, B, r, s and |r|, |s| < 1 because the series of each sequence converges.

gpt-5-codex.title: Relate ratios using product-sum condition
gpt-5-codex.body: Compute ∑ a_n = A/(1-r), ∑ b_n = B/(1-s), and ∑ a_n b_n = AB/(1 - r s). The equality AB/(1 - rs) = (A/(1 - r))(B/(1 - s)) simplifies (after canceling AB ≠ 0) to (1 - r)(1 - s) = 1 - rs, which rearranges to s = r/(2r - 1), assuming r ≠ 1/2.

gpt-5-codex.title: Solve absolute-value sum condition
gpt-5-codex.body: Using |a_{2n}| = |A||r|^{2n-1} and |a_{3n}| = |A||r|^{3n-1}, compute the sums: ∑ |a_{2n}| = |A||r|/(1 - |r|^2) and ∑ |a_{3n}| = |A||r|^2/(1 - |r|^3). The relation 3∑|a_{2n}| = 7∑|a_{3n}| becomes 3|r|/(1 - |r|^2) = 7|r|^2/(1 - |r|^3). With |r| ≠ 0, this simplifies to 4|r|^3 - 7|r| + 3 = 0, whose admissible solution in (0,1) is |r| = 1/2.

gpt-5-codex.title: Determine ratio signs and obtain s
gpt-5-codex.body: Since r ≠ 1/2 (from step 1), the solution |r| = 1/2 forces r = -1/2. Substitute into s = r/(2r - 1) to find s = (-1/2)/(-2) = 1/4.

gpt-5.title: Parameterize the sequences
gpt-5.body: Let a_n = A r^(n-1), b_n = B q^(n-1) with A,B ≠ 0 and |r|, |q| < 1 (since the series converge). Then sum a_n = A/(1 - r), sum b_n = B/(1 - q), and sum a_n b_n = AB/(1 - r q).

gpt-5.title: Use product-of-sums condition
gpt-5.body: Given sum a_n b_n = (sum a_n)(sum b_n), we get AB/(1 - r q) = (A/(1 - r))(B/(1 - q)). Cancelling AB ≠ 0 gives (1 - r)(1 - q) = 1 - r q, hence 2 r q = r + q.

gpt-5.title: Solve for r and q from absolute-sum condition
gpt-5.body: Let x = |r|. Then |a_{2n}| = |A| x^(2n-1), so sum |a_{2n}| = |A| x/(1 - x^2). Also |a_{3n}| = |A| x^(3n-1), so sum |a_{3n}| = |A| x^2/(1 - x^3). The condition 3 sum |a_{2n}| = 7 sum |a_{3n}| gives 3/(1 - x^2) = 7 x/(1 - x^3) ⇒ 4 x^3 - 7 x + 3 = 0. Its roots are x = 1, 1/2, -3/2; with 0 < x < 1, we get |r| = 1/2. Check sign via 2 r q = r + q: if r = 1/2, then q = 1/2 + q (impossible), so r = -1/2. Plugging r = -1/2 into 2 r q = r + q gives -q = -1/2 + q ⇒ q = 1/4.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up geometric series notation
claude-opus-4.5.body:
Let $\{a_n\}$ have first term $a$ and common ratio $r$, so $a_n = ar^{n-1}$.
Let $\{b_n\}$ have first term $b$ and common ratio $s$, so $b_n = bs^{n-1}$.
For convergence: $|r| < 1$ and $|s| < 1$.

The sums are:
$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n = \frac{a}{1-r}$
$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_n = \frac{b}{1-s}$
$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n b_n = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} ab(rs)^{n-1} = \frac{ab}{1-rs}$

claude-opus-4.5.title: Apply first condition
claude-opus-4.5.body:
From $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n b_n = \left(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n\right) \times \left(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_n\right)$:

$\frac{ab}{1-rs} = \frac{a}{1-r} \cdot \frac{b}{1-s} = \frac{ab}{(1-r)(1-s)}$

Since $ab \neq 0$:
$1-rs = (1-r)(1-s) = 1 - r - s + rs$
$-rs = -r - s + rs$
$r + s = 2rs$

If $rs \neq 0$: $\frac{1}{s} + \frac{1}{r} = 2$, i.e., $\frac{r+s}{rs} = 2$

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find s using the relation
claude-opus-4.5.body:
From $r + s = 2rs$ with $r = \pm\frac{1}{2}$:

Case $r = \frac{1}{2}$: $\frac{1}{2} + s = s$, giving $\frac{1}{2} = 0$ (contradiction)

So we use: $\frac{1}{r} + \frac{1}{s} = 2$
With $r = \frac{1}{2}$: $2 + \frac{1}{s} = 2$, so $\frac{1}{s} = 0$ (invalid)

With $r = -\frac{1}{2}$: $-2 + \frac{1}{s} = 2$, so $\frac{1}{s} = 4$, thus $s = \frac{1}{4}$

gemini-3-pro.title: Derive relation between ratios
gemini-3-pro.body: Let the first terms of the geometric sequences $\{a_n\}$ and $\{b_n\}$ be $a$ and $b$, and their common ratios be $r$ and $s$, respectively. The first condition is $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n b_n = (\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} a_n)(\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} b_n)$. Using the sum formula for geometric series, this implies $\frac{ab}{1-rs} = \frac{a}{1-r} \times \frac{b}{1-s}$. Simplifying $\frac{1}{1-rs} = \frac{1}{1-s-r+rs}$ leads to $1-s-r+rs = 1-rs$, which simplifies to $2rs = r+s$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Determine |r| from absolute sums
gemini-3-pro.body: Analyze the condition $3 \sum |a_{2n}| = 7 \sum |a_{3n}|$. The sequence $\{|a_{2n}|\}$ has first term $|ar|$ and ratio $|r|^2$. Its sum is $\frac{|ar|}{1-|r|^2}$. The sequence $\{|a_{3n}|\}$ has first term $|ar^2|$ and ratio $|r|^3$. Its sum is $\frac{|ar^2|}{1-|r|^3}$. The equation becomes $3 \frac{|r|}{1-|r|^2} = 7 \frac{|r|^2}{1-|r|^3}$. Let $x=|r|$. Dividing by non-zero factors and simplifying yields $\frac{3}{1+x} = \frac{7x}{1+x+x^2}$. Cross-multiplying gives $3(1+x+x^2) = 7x(1+x)$, which reduces to $4x^2 + 4x - 3 = 0$. Factoring as $(2x-1)(2x+3)=0$, we find $x=1/2$ (since $x>0$). Thus, $|r|=1/2$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Find common ratios r and s
gemini-3-pro.body:
Since $|r|=1/2$, $r$ is either $1/2$ or $-1/2$. We substitute into $2rs = r+s$ to find $s$. Solving for $s$: $s(2r-1) = r$, so $s = \frac{r}{2r-1}$.
If $r=1/2$, the denominator $2(1/2)-1 = 0$, so no solution exists.
If $r=-1/2$, $s = \frac{-1/2}{-1-1} = \frac{-1/2}{-2} = \frac{1}{4}$.
Thus, $r=-1/2$ and $s=1/4$. Both satisfy the convergence condition (absolute value < 1).

gemini-3-pro.title: Compute the sum S
gemini-3-pro.body:
We need to calculate $S = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \frac{b_{2n-1} + b_{3n+1}}{b_n}$. Substitute $b_n = b s^{n-1}$. The general term is $\frac{b s^{2n-2} + b s^{3n}}{b s^{n-1}} = s^{n-1} + s^{2n+1}$.
$S = \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} s^{n-1} + \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} s^{2n+1}$.
The first sum is $\frac{1}{1-s}$. The second sum is a geometric series with first term $s^3$ and ratio $s^2$, so it sums to $\frac{s^3}{1-s^2}$.
Using $s=1/4$: $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} s^{n-1} = \frac{1}{1-1/4} = \frac{4}{3}$.
$\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} s^{2n+1} = \frac{(1/4)^3}{1-(1/4)^2} = \frac{1/64}{15/16} = \frac{1}{60}$.
$S = \frac{4}{3} + \frac{1}{60} = \frac{80}{60} + \frac{1}{60} = \frac{81}{60} = \frac{27}{20}$.

grok-4-fast.title: Define geometric sequences
grok-4-fast.body:
Denote the sequences: \(a_n = A r^{n-1}\) with \(|r| < 1\), and \(b_n = B s^{n-1}\) with \(|s| < 1\), where \(A 
eq 0\), \(B 
eq 0\). The infinite sums are \(\sum a_n = A / (1 - r)\) and \(\sum b_n = B / (1 - s)\).

grok-4-fast.title: Apply product of sums condition
grok-4-fast.body: The condition \(\sum a_n b_n = (\sum a_n)(\sum b_n)\) gives \(\sum (A B (r s)^{n-1}) = A B / (1 - r s)\), so \(1 / (1 - r s) = 1 / [(1 - r)(1 - s)]\). Simplifying yields \((1 - r)(1 - s) = 1 - r s\), or \(r + s = 2 r s\), equivalently \(1/r + 1/s = 2\).

grok-4-fast.title: Apply absolute value sum condition
grok-4-fast.body: Compute \(\sum |a_{2n}| = |A r| / (1 - |r|^2)\) and \(\sum |a_{3n}| = |A| |r|^2 / (1 - |r|^3)\). The condition \(3 \sum |a_{2n}| = 7 \sum |a_{3n}|\) simplifies to \(3 x / (1 - x^2) = 7 x^2 / (1 - x^3)\) where \(x = |r|\). Solving \(4 x^3 - 7 x + 3 = 0\) gives roots \(x = 1\) (invalid) and \(x = 1/2\), so \(|r| = 1/2\).
